alert.note: Alert for Klamath; Lake (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 12 at 2:26PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT WEDNESDAY FOR KLAMATH AND LAKE COUNTIES... The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect until noon PDT Wednesday. Wildfires burning in the region, particularly the Cedar Creek Fire in the High Cascades near Oakridge and Highway 58, combined with forecast weather conditions, will cause air quality levels to fluctuate such that they`re likely to be at unhealthy levels, at times, across Klamath and Lake counties. More specifically, poor air quality north through east of Klamath Falls this Monday afternoon is likely to be most hazardous to health today through Tuesday morning, with the worst air quality forecast to be across northern portions of Klamath and Lake counties. Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning air quality is likely to be more variable as some smoke arrives from the Mosquito Fire in California during the day, followed by another round of smoke from the northwest from the Cedar Creek Fire Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected. For additional information...please visit the web site at http://www.oregon.gov/deq Additional real time and smoke information can be found at https://www.fire.airnow.gov
